author: sonus21
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
Install PowerShell from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v6.0.0-beta.4/powershell-6.0.0-beta.4-osx.10.12-x64.pkg
>sudo powershell

```powershell
Install-Module AzureRM
Login-AzureRmAccount
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Prompt for Login
```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------
VERBOSE: Loading module from path '/usr/local/microsoft/powershell/6.0.0-beta.4/Modules/AzureRM/4.2.1/AzureRM.psd1'.
VERBOSE: Populating RepositorySourceLocation property for module AzureRM.
VERBOSE: Loading module from path '/usr/local/microsoft/powershell/6.0.0-beta.4/Modules/AzureRM/4.2.1/AzureRM.psm1'.
Import-Module : The Azure PowerShell session has not been properly initialized.  Please import the module and try again.
At /usr/local/microsoft/powershell/6.0.0-beta.4/Modules/AzureRM/4.2.1/AzureRM.psm1:15 char:3
+   Import-Module AzureRM.Profile -RequiredVersion 3.2.1
+   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Import-Module], InvalidOperationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.InvalidOperationException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand

comments.body: @sonus21 Thanks for your report! We already have the same Issue #4090.

title: Import-Module error on Mac OS-10.12
